greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Minimal number of terms of A005826 needed to sum to n.
comment: Watson showed that a(n) <= 8 for all n.
It is likely that a(n) <= 6 for all n (see A193107).
link: H. E. Salzer and N. Levine, Proof that every integer <= 452,479,659 is a sum of five numbers of the form Q_x = (x^3+5x)/6, x>= 0, Math. Comp., (1968), 191-192.
G. L. Watson, Sums of eight values of a cubic polynomial, J. London Math. Soc., 27 (1952), 217-224.
maple: LAGRANGE(t1, 8 120); # the LAGRANGE transform of a sequence is defined in A193101 - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 15 2011
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 15 2011
